title: India-Pak match draws ire: Oppn terms it betrayal of martyrs; govt responds
content: The India-Pakistan Asia Cup match in Dubai has ignited political controversy, with opposition parties condemning it as insensitive after the Pahalgam terror attack, while the government defends it as a sporting event separate from political tensions.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; How can you create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google’s Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: Asia Cup: Beating India? Pakistan urged to 'push 10–20% extra' by Panesar
content: Monty Panesar has declared India as favorites in their upcoming Asia Cup clash against Pakistan in Dubai, citing India's balanced team composition. Despite tense political relations and the absence of key veterans like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for India, and Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan for Pakistan, both teams have started strongly with convincing victories in the tournament.

title: Metaverse, AI & drones: Terrorists exploiting emerging tech; Quad's new priority
content: Despite summit uncertainties, Quad nations are actively pursuing counterterrorism efforts, including workshops addressing drone misuse and the exploitation of emerging technologies by terrorists. India acknowledges US commitment to the Quad, even amidst evolving US-China relations. The group will also launch its Ports of the Future Partnership, highlighting ongoing cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Amazon suspends engineer: Sent 'threatening' letter to CEO Andy Jassy
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Online betting app case: ED summons actor Urvashi Rautela, ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned actress Urvashi Rautela as part of its money laundering investigation into the online betting platform 1xBet. This action follows similar summonses issued to other celebrities, including cricketer Shikhar Dhawan and Suresh Raina.

title: Viral video: Mike Tyson floors MrBeast with knockout punch at Canelo v Crawford
content: Before the Canelo Álvarez vs. Terence Crawford fight in Las Vegas, MrBeast was punched in the stomach by Mike Tyson for entertainment. The video quickly went viral, sparking debate online. Later that night, Crawford defeated Álvarez in twelve rounds to become the undisputed super middleweight champion. Crawford's victory came as a shock during Mexico’s Independence weekend, solidifying his legacy.

title: 'We don't plan wars': China hits back at Trump's threat; slams US appeal to Nato
content: China's foreign minister Wang Yi has responded to US calls for Nato to impose hefty tariffs on Beijing over its alleged support for Russia in the Ukraine war, reiterating China's commitment to peace talks and multilateralism. Trump proposed tariffs of 50-100% on China, claiming it would pressure Russia to end the conflict.

title: Musk’s $1 trillion pay: Tesla board chairperson defends proposal; shares conditions
content: Tesla's board chair, Robyn Denholm, defends Elon Musk's proposed compensation plan, potentially worth $1 trillion, emphasizing its focus on future performance and ambitious goals like robotaxis and robots. Denholm argues Musk's motivation lies in achieving unprecedented technological advancements and gaining voting influence for Tesla's future growth, despite concerns over recent sales declines and Cybertruck performance.

title: Suicidal thoughts? Shami on darkest phase of life: 'Socha zaroor, par hua nahin'
content: Indian fast bowler Mohammed Shami revealed he contemplated suicide during a difficult period marked by personal and professional struggles. He credited his love for cricket and the support from fans for preventing him from taking that step. Shami has faced criticism and allegations in recent years, impacting his form and leading to his exclusion from the Asia Cup squad.

title: Assam: PM Modi hits out at Congress, Nehru; accuses party of backing terrorists over Army
content: During his Assam visit, Prime Minister Modi criticized Nehru's handling of the 1962 Chinese aggression, claiming Assam still suffers. He contrasted Congress's limited infrastructure development with his government's construction of six Brahmaputra bridges in the last decade. Modi accused Congress of supporting infiltrators and insulting Bhupen Hazarika.

title: Punjab: SAD leader's son dies in road accident in Jalandhar; CM Mann expresses grief
content: Richi Kaypee, son of SAD leader Mohinder Singh Kaypee, tragically died in a road accident in Jalandhar on Saturday night. His SUV was struck by a speeding vehicle near Mata Rani Chowk, also impacting two other vehicles. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and SAD president Sukhbir Singh Badal expressed their condolences to the Kaypee family.

title: Asia Cup: Suniel Shetty backs India playing Pakistan - 'You can't blame anybody'
content: Amid calls to boycott the India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash following the Pahalgam terror attack, Suniel Shetty emphasized that cricketers shouldn't be blamed for playing, as they represent the country under international sporting regulations. Fielding coach Ryan ten Doeschate echoed this, stating the team is focused on the game, adhering to BCCI and government directives, while acknowledging public sentiment.

title: Will Moore play against Detroit Lions tonight? Here's the answer
content: DJ Moore is set to play in tonight's NFC North showdown against the Detroit Lions, boosting the Chicago Bears' offense. As rookie quarterback Caleb Williams faces his first divisional road test, Moore's presence as the top wide receiver is crucial. Moore's chemistry with Williams and ability to stretch the field make him a focal point in Chicago's passing game.

title: Tyreek Hill faces suspension as women’s group challenges over domestic violence probe
content: NFL star Tyreek Hill faces fresh domestic abuse allegations from his wife, Keeta Vaccaro, who detailed multiple violent incidents in divorce papers. Despite the charges, Hill is expected to play against the Patriots, sparking outrage. The National Organization for Women demands his immediate suspension, criticizing the NFL's handling of violence against women.

title: From zones to family attractions- What’s new this year in Riyadh season
content: Riyadh Season 2025 will begin in October, bringing an exciting mix of world-class sports, music, and cultural events, including the debut Riyadh Comedy Festival and the return of the Six Kings Slam tennis tournament. Aligned with Saudi Vision 2030, it emphasizes Arabic talent and international collaborations, further establishing Riyadh as a vibrant global hub for entertainment and culture.

title: 'Op Sindoor a waste': Pahalgam victim slams India vs Pak match
content: The scheduled Asia Cup 2025 India-Pakistan cricket match in Dubai faces strong opposition from Indian fans following the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in civilian casualties. Families of victims express their grief and question the decision to proceed with the match despite the recent Operation Sindoor and cross-border tensions.

title: 'Won't stay for more than six months': Nepal PM Sushila Karki's first address
content: Sushila Karki, former Chief Justice of Nepal, has assumed the role of interim Prime Minister amidst national unrest, becoming the first woman to hold the position. Following violent protests sparked by a social media ban and fueled by demands for economic reform and accountability, Karki's government aims to ensure stability, deliver justice, and prepare for elections within six months.

title: Asia Cup: 'Even die-hard fans won’t know them' — Ex-India star slams Pakistan team
content: Nikhil Chopra critiques Pakistan's current Asia Cup squad, suggesting it lacks the iconic figures of the past, unlike India, whose team is brimming with experienced match-winners. He highlights India's depth, noting that even promising talents like Yashasvi Jaiswal are struggling to find a place in the playing eleven. India demonstrated their strength by crushing UAE in their opening match.

title: Paresh Rawal reacts to clash between his film 'Ajey' and Akshay's 'Jolly LLB 3'
content: Recent tensions between Paresh Rawal and Akshay Kumar regarding 'Hera Pheri 3' have eased, with Rawal set to reprise his role. Before that, Kumar stars in 'Jolly LLB 3', while Rawal takes on 'Ajey: The Untold Story of a Yogi'. Rawal expressed optimism about the box-office clash between Kumar's film and others.

title: Shocking! Olympic medallist disqualified from World C'ships; suspension possible
content: Aman Sehrawat, a promising Indian wrestler, was disqualified from the World Wrestling Championships in Zagreb after exceeding the weight limit by 1.7 kg. The Wrestling Federation of India is considering suspension, mirroring a previous penalty for a similar infraction. Coaches reported Sehrawat fell ill, hindering his ability to cut weight before the weigh-in.

title: $3.4 bn push: India set to build new rail lines near China border; why it’s important
content: India is set to bolster its northeastern border security by investing $3.4 billion in railway infrastructure. This ambitious project aims to construct 500 kilometers of railway tracks, enhancing connectivity to isolated regions bordering China, Bangladesh, Myanmar, and Bhutan.

title: Asia Cup: Boycott or not, tension is real in India's camp ahead of IND vs PAK clash
content: On the eve of India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan, India’s assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate, who hails from the Netherlands, discovered how India vs Pakistan begins long before the first ball, and why cricket is never just about cricket.

title: Relief aid diverted? Pak funding reconstruction of LeT HQ destroyed in Op Sindoor; what intel says
content: Pakistan is allegedly funding the reconstruction of Lashkar-e-Taiba's (LeT) headquarters, Markaz Taiba, destroyed in airstrikes, raising concerns about regional security. LeT is reportedly raising funds under the guise of flood relief, with Islamabad allocating PKR 4 crore for the project. The facility serves as a training ground for terrorists, potentially strengthening LeT's operational capabilities and recruitment efforts.

title: Asia Cup: 'No competition' – Ex-Pak star on fading hype around IND vs PAK
content: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria claimed the India-Pakistan cricket rivalry has diminished due to Pakistan's declining standards. He cited the absence of key players like Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan in the upcoming Asia Cup clash. Kaneria believed India are far superior, even without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, and anticipated a one-sided contest.

title: ‘Pothole-free’: Bengaluru gets Rs 1,100cr to fix its roads; big relief for commuters
content: Bengaluru's road infrastructure is set for a major overhaul with a Rs 1,100 crore investment, announced Deputy CM DK Shivakumar. Aiming for smooth, pothole-free roads, each of 14 assembly constituencies will receive Rs 50 crore, while others get Rs 25 crore for repairs and new construction.

title: If it’s Pakistan, unleash Bumrah! India eye dominance in Dubai
content: Jasprit Bumrah has consistently delivered match-winning performances against Pakistan in crucial encounters. From the World Cup clash in Ahmedabad to the T20 World Cup thriller in New York, Bumrah's game-changing spells have swung the momentum in India's favor. As India prepares to face Pakistan in Dubai, all eyes will be on Bumrah to replicate his heroics and silence his critics.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: FBI says Tyler Robinson's transgender partner 'had no idea'
content: Tyler Robinson, accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk, had a partner who is fully cooperating with the FBI investigation. Officials confirm the partner, described as a male transitioning to female, was unaware of Robinson's alleged plan. Text messages and digital evidence seized from their shared apartment are being analyzed, as the FBI investigates all connections to the case.

title: Sanctions bite: Nayara Energy struggles with non-Russian crude for 2nd consecutive month
content: Nayara Energy, part-owned by Russia's Rosneft, faces challenges securing non-Russian crude due to western shipping companies' reluctance. This has led to reduced operations at its Vadinar refinery and increased reliance on Russian oil. Despite sanctions and executive resignations, Nayara is exploring alternative contractors for its investment program, while India continues to import significant Russian crude due to price advantages.

title: Who was Assaf bin Yousha, viral infant son of Saudi influencer Yusha Abdulaziz
content: Assaf bin Yousha, the 17-month-old son of Saudi influencers Musa bin Turki and Yusha Abdulaziz, tragically passed away after reportedly drowning in his aunt’s pool during a family visit. The news, announced Fri day, sparked nationwide mourning. Assaf, a familiar face on Snapchat, had captured the hearts of over a million followers with his joyful presence.

title: Asia Cup: Shubman Gill injured before Pakistan match? Here's what happened in Dubai
content: During India's Asia Cup practice in Dubai, Shubman Gill was hit on the hand, causing immediate concern as he left the field in pain. After medical attention and ice treatment, Gill returned to the nets, batting comfortably against both pace and spin. He concluded the session positively, even socializing before heading back to the dressing room.

title: ‘Held kids’ heads underwater’: Bengaluru couple kills 2 children, plans suicide
content: In a tragic incident in Gonakanahalli village, Shivu and his two children, Chandrakala and Uday Surya, were found dead. Shivu's wife, Manjula, survived an attempted suicide and is now in police custody. Facing financial struggles, the couple had discussed suicide, leading to the deaths of their children before Shivu took his own life. Manjula is currently under investigation.

title: 'Unite the Kingdom': Massive anti-immigration protests rock London; cops 'assaulted with kicks, punches'
content: London witnessed a massive "Unite the Kingdom" rally led by far-right activist Tommy Robinson, drawing over 100,000 participants expressing anti-migrant sentiments. The march, framed as a free speech event, featured speakers promoting racist conspiracy theories, sparking clashes with police and a counter-protest.

title: Car plunges from flyover onto railway tracks in Delhi; train services halted
content: On Sunday, a car plunged from the Mukarba Chowk flyover onto railway tracks near Haiderpur Metro Station in Delhi, disrupting rail traffic for an hour. The driver, Sachin Chaudhary, sustained minor injuries after losing control of his vehicle. Authorities also found an unrelated abandoned motorcycle at the scene, prompting a separate investigation.

title: '100% chance he'd be killed': Did Charlie Kirk play down security intel?
content: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk, a close ally of Donald Trump, was fatally shot while addressing an event at Utah Valley University. Security expert Kris Herzog had warned Kirk months prior of a potential assassination attempt, urging him to take safety precautions. Herzog expressed regret that Kirk did not heed his warnings.

title: H-1B holders over Americans? Elon Musk's Tesla sued for discrimination
content: Tesla is facing a class-action lawsuit alleging discrimination against American workers. The suit claims Tesla favored H-1B visa holders to cut labor costs, disproportionately hiring them while laying off US citizens. Plaintiffs allege bias in hiring and firings, citing instances where American applicants were denied jobs in favor of visa-sponsored candidates, leading to wage theft.

title: 'Fight back or die': Musk's strong message at UK anti-immigration protest - watch
content: Elon Musk voiced his support for anti-immigration protests in the UK, urging Britons to "fight back or die" against current policies. He criticized the government's immigration strategies, alleging a voter import scheme. A large far-right demonstration in London led by activist Tommy Robinson resulted in clashes, with numerous injuries and arrests amidst police intervention and counter-protests.

title: 'Bedsheets unchanged, toilets inaccessible': Tejashwi flags crisis at Bihar govt hospital
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav criticized Bihar's NDA government for the failing public healthcare system, citing poor conditions at Purnea's GMCH. During a surprise inspection, he found patients sharing beds, unsanitary conditions, and staff shortages. Yadav alleged corruption in construction and equipment purchases, ahead of PM Modi's visit.

title: IND vs PAK: No Kohli, no Rohit… but plenty of swagger! India ready for Pakistan clash
content: India face Pakistan in the Asia Cup without Kohli and Sharma, but a dominant win against UAE signalled their strength. Pakistan, despite a victory over Oman, showed vulnerabilities in their batting and spin attack. India, boasting a strong T20I record and recent form, enter as favourites amid a subdued build-up due to political tensions.

title: Crawford tops Canelo for historic undisputed title
content: Terence Crawford made history by defeating Canelo Alvarez to become the first undisputed champion in three weight classes in the four-belt era.

title: Bulldogs' reign over Vols continues with OT win
content: Trailing by 14 in the first half, No. 6 Georgia engineered a thrilling rally at Tennessee, outlasting the No. 15 Volunteers 44-41 in overtime for the Bulldogs' ninth straight win in the rivalry.

title: Irked Kelly fires back at doubters after LSU win
content: LSU coach Brian Kelly didn't hold back in his postgame media availability following a 20-10 win over Florida that perhaps wasn't as glamorous as it could have been, telling reporters "I really don't care. We're trying to win football games."

title: Booed by own fans, Arch says he must improve
content: Arch Manning, who was booed by Texas fans Saturday, said he must play better for the Longhorns to be a title contender.

title: A&M kicks 'door down' with defining win over ND
content: Texas A&M erased five deficits to stun No. 8 Notre Dame 41-40, recording its first road win against an AP top-10 opponent since 2014 at Auburn.

title: Aggies' Anderson has feeling in limbs after hit
content: Texas A&M safety Bryce Anderson has feeling in his limbs after being taken to a local hospital following a play that left him motionless late in the first half of the Aggies' 41-40 win over Notre Dame Fighting Irish in South Bend, Indiana, on Saturday.

title: Jazz on Yankees' surge: 'We're the team to beat'
content: Jazz Chisholm Jr. attributed the Yankees' recent turnaround while facing good teams to a belief that they are "the team to beat" in the American League.

title: Pry's seat hotter after 0-3 Hokies fall to ODU
content: In a pivotal season for Brent Pry, Virginia Tech fell to 0-3 Saturday, as the Hokies lost to Old Dominion 45-26 at home. Virginia Tech dropped to 16-24 in his tenure, including a two-game run this year in which the team was outscored 89-46.

title: 📈 Fantasy football rankings for NFL Week 2
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: WNBA playoff preview: Stars, matchups and X factors that could decide the champion
content: We break down all eight teams in the WNBA postseason, from their best assets to potential fatal flaws.

title: Week 2 inactives: Who's in and who's out?
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Ready for Sunday? We have last-minute Week 2 sleepers, surprises, trends to watch and more
content: Can J.J. McCarthy find ways to beat Jessie Bates? Does Juwan Johnson have fantasy appeal? And could James Conner have a big rushing day?

title: Betting Falcons-Vikings: Will Minnesota carry Week 1 momentum into Sunday night?
content: From our favorite game bets and props to the latest odds and trends, here's everything you need to know to bet Falcons-Vikings.

title: Week 2 best bets: What will Josh Allen do for an encore?
content: Dissecting the lines and props on both sides of the ball that offer value for Week 2 of the NFL season.

title: What's it like to catch a TD from both Rodgers and Favre?
content: The Steelers passer is one touchdown from tying the Packers legend at No. 4 in career passing TDs. One player opens up about both QBs.

title: Before Joe Flacco was the Browns QB, he was Baltimore's 'Joe Cool'
content: From the Ravens to the Browns, we have stories of how the QB is "ice cold when it comes to clutch situations."

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Barcelona track Palmeiras' Benedetti
content: Arsenal are ready to rival Barcelona for 19-year-old Palmeiras left-back Luiz Benedetti. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Who wins the PLL championship? Key stats, matchups, X factors for Outlaws-Atlas
content: The top two teams are set to clash on Sunday, with a title on the line. Here's everything you need to know.

title: What is Aspiration, the company behind the Kawhi Leonard deal?
content: Here's what we know about now-defunct Aspiration, the company at the center of the salary cap circumvention accusations.

title: WNBA playoff predictions: Can anyone prevent Lynx-Aces Finals matchup?
content: From the first round to Finals MVP, we predict whether Minnesota can hold off red-hot Las Vegas and the field.

title: Strength in depth at last? Zubimendi, Gyökeres spark Arsenal win
content: It turned out to be an easy win for Arsenal over Nottingham Forest, and Mikel Arteta's summer signings stole the show.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 2.0: Balogun, Zendejas on the rise
content: With nine months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make the squad after a turbulent September window?

title: Arizona's throwback helmets and Oregon's colorful combo lead top Week 3 college football uniforms
content: The Tennessee Volunteers are sticking with their classically excellent combination of orange and white for a major SEC showdown with the Georgia Bulldogs.

title: 🏈 Ranking NFL QB debuts from Fields to Rodgers
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

title: 🤯 Inside Rob Ryan's most surprising move yet
content: Even though Rob Ryan hasn't coached college football in over 25 years, he has already acclimated to life in L.A.

title: ⚾ Why each MLB contender can win the World Series
content: Lack of power? Bullpen holes? Injured stars? Why each contender's biggest weakness will -- or won't -- sink them in October.

title: 🔥 Which CFB coaches are on the hot seat?
content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

title: 🏀 Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ↔️ Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: 12-Year-Old Boy Takes Own Life After Mother Scolds Him In UP: Cops
content: A 12-year-old boy allegedly took his own life in the Manpur area of Moradabad district after being scolded by his mother, police said on Sunday.

title: 12-Year-Old Boy Takes Own Life After Mother Scolds Him In UP: Cops
content: A 12-year-old boy allegedly took his own life in the Manpur area of Moradabad district after being scolded by his mother, police said on Sunday.

title: Operation Sindoor Bravehearts Rebuild Lives At Pune Artificial Limb Centre
content: Corporal Varun Kumar, a paramedic with the Indian Air Force, lost his right hand when an enemy missile struck a first-aid post at the forward location of Udhampur airbase during Operation Sindoor.

title: Priya Sachdev Kapur Makes 1st Appearance After Husband Sunjay Kapur's Death
content: In her first appearance since her husband and industrialist Sunjay Kapur's death, Priya Sachdev Kapur attended the Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India meet.

title: An ATM Card vs Chequebook Battle Amid War Of Promises In Poll-Bound Bihar
content: Posters and pamphlets are passe, and an ATM card vs chequebook battle is playing out in Bihar's poll arena as political parties explore creative ways to showcase their promises to voters.

title: Delhi Man Found Dead In Hotel Room After Party With Friends, Family Claims Murder
content: A man died at a hotel in northeast Delhi after partying with his friends, police said on Sunday. The deceased's family suspects that he was drugged and killed during the party.

title: Trinamool Ex-MP Mimi Chakraborty, Actor Urvashi Rautela Summoned In Betting App Case
content: Trinamool ex MP Mimi Chakraborty, actor Urvashi Rautela have been asked by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to appear before them in connection with an alleged illegal betting app case.

title: Trump Adopts Messenger-In-Chief Role After Charlie Kirk's Death
content: Since the US conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot in a brazen display of violence, President Donald Trump has embraced the role of spokesman in an extraordinary way.

title: Amit Khare Appointed Secretary To Vice-President CP Radhakrishnan
content: The government on Sunday appointed former bureaucrat Amit Khare as Secretary to the new Vice President C P Radhakrishnan.

title: Young Activists Who Toppled Nepal's Government Now Picking New Leaders
content: A former DJ and his obscure Nepalese non-profit used a social media app popular with video gamers to drive massive protests and become the unlikely power brokers in installing the country's new interim leadership.

title: Temple Wedding, Abortion, Then Mystery Death: Tale Of Two Bengal Doctors
content: A junior doctor has been arrested in West Bengal's Malda after his girlfriend -- a 24-year-old MBBS student -- died under mysterious circumstances while she was visiting him

title: From Villages To Forests: Terrorists In J&K Now Hiding In Underground Bunkers
content: In a change of tactics, terror outfits in Jammu and Kashmir are now constructing elaborately-designed underground bunkers deep inside thick forests and elevated ridges instead of taking shelter in local houses, officials said on Sunday.

title: On CCTV, Truck's Tyre Bursts At Jaipur Toll Booth, Narrow Escape For Staff
content: A worker at a toll booth in Jaipur had a narrow escape after a tyre of a truck that had stopped burst, creating a huge explosion on Saturday.

title: 'Different Kind Of Spiritual Joy': PM Modi Launches Rs 6,300 Crore Projects In Assam
content: PM Narendra Modi said he experienced "a different kind of spiritual joy" on his visit to Assam, coinciding with Janmashtami celebrations here, as he launched a series of major health and infrastructure projects in Darrang worth over Rs 6,300 crore.

title: "Hindi Not A Rival, But A Friend To Indian Languages": Amit Shah On Hindi Diwas
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said Hindi should not be viewed as a rival to other Indian languages, but as their companion, stressing that languages must be seen as partners in nation-building.

title: Texas Bans Sharia Law After Cleric Asks Shopkeepers Not To Sell Liquor, Pork
content: Texas Governor Greg Abbott has said his state has banned the enforcement of Islamic Sharia law and urged residents to report any attempts to impose "Sharia compliance" on businesses or individuals.

title: "Not Here To Taste Power": Nepal's New PM Sets A 6-Month Deadline
content: Sushila Karki, Nepal's interim Prime Minister and former Chief Justice of its Supreme Court, has said that she and her team are not interested in power and would hand over the country's responsibility to a new parliament within six months.

title: Marco Rubio Visits Israel In Aftermath Of Israel's Qatar Strikes
content: Top US diplomat Marco Rubio began a visit to Israel on Sunday, after expressing the Trump administration's unwavering support for its ally in the war with Hamas despite a strike in Qatar that drew broad criticism of Israel.

title: "How Can He Do It": Union Minister Loses Cool At Karnataka Cop Over Lathicharge
content: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday demanded the suspension of the senior police officer who ordered a lathi-charge on people who were part of the Ganesh idol immersion procession in Karnataka's Dharwad last week.

title: Maoist killed in gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand
content: The deceased was identified as Mukhdev Yadav (40), a self-styled commander of the banned Maoist splinter group Tritiya Sammelan Prastuti Committee (TSPC), SP Reeshma Ramesan said

title: Peaking over 88,000 cases, pendency continues to plague Supreme Court
content: The filing of fresh cases in August surpassed the disposal rate; the court is currently functioning with its full sanctioned judicial strength of 34 judges

title: Bird hit forces Air India Express flight to return at Kannur airport
content: The aircraft took off at 6.36 a.m. with 180 passengers on board, but returned back to the airport 45 minutes later

title: Supreme Court to consider SIT report on Vantara on September 15
content: Sealed report by SIT led by ex-judge J. Chelameswar to be taken up; probe examines acquisition, welfare and compliance issues

title: GST regime has benefited people, State governments: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman
content: She said, in the latest GST reforms, 99% of all the goods which were in the 12% GST bracket have now come under the 5% GST bracket.

title: Governor is the proper person to answer why Bills passed by Kerala Assembly are on hold: Speaker A.N. Shamseer
content: He urges the mediapersons to put the question to the Governor on  whether it is right to put on hold a Bill which has been passed after hours of discussion

title: An island on Adyar Estuary is now home to a new mangrove belt
content: Around 5,000 mangrove saplings have been planted at the site after invasive species were removed, and a cleanup drive was carried out by the Chennai Forest Division on August 2

title: Ahead of socio-educational survey, confusion among Veerashaiva-Lingayats resurfaces with conflicting directions
content: In the last few decades, the Veerashaiva-Lingayats faces a dilemma over nomenclature every time a census is undertaken and after the 2017 mega movement for the independent religion status for Lingayatism, the issue seems to have become even more complex.

title: Beggars’ homes are treated worse than prisons and run like ‘discretionary charity’ by state: SC judgment
content: Supreme Court issues series of directions for health screening, audit of beggars’ homes across the country

title: Thane 2015 riot case: Ten years on, court acquits all 17 accused
content: “The prosecution’s evidence was insufficient to prove the guilt of the accused beyond a reasonable doubt,” Additional Sessions Judge Vasudha L. Bhosale said

title: From safe houses to subterranean sanctuaries: Terror outfits change tactics
content: Terror outfits in J&K shift to constructing underground bunkers in forests, posing new challenge for security forces

title: Allies turned opponents UPPL, BJP promise lasting peace in Assam’s BTC poll manifestos
content: The ruling United People’s Party Liberal outlines a five-prong strategy for a cleaner, greener, and happier Bodoland Territorial Region

title: Dasara 2025: Special breakfast served to mahouts and kavadis
content: Minister H.C. Mahadevappa inaugurated a temporary school set-up for the children of mahouts and kavadis on the occasion, and also visited the temporary health centre set up for the families of the mahouts and kavadis.

title: Dasara 2025: Invitation extended to Pramoda Devi Wadiyar
content: Dasara festival is scheduled to be inaugurated atop Chamundi Hills on September 22 and will conclude with the Vijayadhashami procession on October 2.

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin to launch Anbukkarangal financial assistance initiative for children on September 15
content: The initiative, which is a part of the ‘Thayumanavar’ scheme, would provide a monthly aid of ₹2,000 to each of the children who have lost their parent(s), till they complete their school education.

title: Broadband internet services restored after week-long suspension in J&K’s Doda
content: The officials said the civil society representatives assured their active support and cooperation to the administration in bringing the situation back on track

title: Owaisi criticizes BJP for allowing India-Pakistan cricket match after terror attack, questioning priorities and patriotism
content: Owaisi sought to know on what grounds the cricket match against Pakistan was being permitted when terrorists had singled out victims in Pahalgam based on religion and shot them dead

title: NDA resolved to unseat DMK from power in 2026: Vasan
content: According to him, the internal issues in the AIADMK were temporary in nature and would be resolved soon.

title: Incessant rains: Woman drowned, one more missing in overflowing stream in Andhra Pradesh’s Eluru district
content: “About 25 streams overflowing, three villages cut-off, police pickets arranged on Andhra Pradesh-Telangana borders,” says DSP M. Venkateswara Rao

title: Great Nicobar project being bulldozed through despite challenges to clearances in courts: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
content: Jairam Ramesh said he has raised this issue previously in a series of letters to the Minister for Environment, Forests, and Climate Change

title: ECI should have ordered probe instead of ‘shouting’ at Rahul Gandhi: former CEC Quraishi on ‘vote theft’ charges
content: S.Y. Quraishi, former Chief Election Commissioner, slammed the Election Commission of India (ECI) over the manner in which it carried out the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar

title: Two workers killed in fire at fertiliser plant in Gujarat's Mehsana
content: Two persons working at the plant during night shift were charred to death; two others were injured and rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment, police said

title: Union Home Minister Amit Shah's appeal on Hindi Diwas: Respect all Indian languages
content: Amit Shah said the greatest strength of India's languages is that they have provided every class and community with an opportunity for expression

title: Madhya Pradesh HC temporarily stops live streaming of criminal cases hearing from September 15
content: Advocate Arihant Tiwari told the HC that the live streaming of court proceedings was being misused by several private entities by creating reels, clips and memes.

title: Mission to counter conspiracy to alter demography soon: PM Modi
content: Addressing a rally in north-central Assam’s Mangaldoi, he said the BJP government’s goal was to save the people of the country from infiltrators

title: In frames | Relentless rain upsets Kashmir’s apple cart
content: Heavy monsoon and unprecedented floods submerge Kashmir’s orchards, damaging the apple crop; closure of the National Highway leaves thousands of trucks stranded, worsening post-harvest losses for the thousands associated with the fruit trade

title: Hindi Diwas 2025: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee extends greetings to people
content: The West Bengal CM listed several initiatives such as the establishment of the Hindi Academy, the setting up of a Hindi University in Howrah, Hindi-medium colleges in Banarhat and Naxalbari, and the introduction of Hindi postgraduate courses in several colleges

title: 67 dog bite cases reported in one day from Kalyan and Dombivli towns in Thane
content: For the past few weeks, the incidents of dog bites were occurring sporadically in the region, averaging a few cases per day

title: PM Modi to inaugurate three-day armed forces’ conference in Kolkata on Sept. 15
content: Focusing on reforms, transformation and operational preparedness, the theme for this year’s conference is ‘Year of Reforms - Transforming for the Future’

title: Andhra Pradesh HC directs govt. to extend tenure of APSCPCR members till new body is formed
content: Consider the representations made to this effect by the APSCPCR Chairperson and members, HC tells the Secretary of WD&CW Department

title: Diamonds and rust
content: With India being the world’s largest exporter of loose cut and polished diamonds, thousands of jewellery exporters in Maharashtra and lakhs of skilled artisans in Gujarat are worried about the impact of the 50% U.S. tariff on gems and 57% on jewels. Business owners tell Vinaya Deshpande Pandit that they are asking the government for short-term policy relief

title: NHRC notice to State police chief over 'assault' on media person in Assam
content: The Lumding Press Club as well as local citizens condemned the alleged incident, demanding strict action against the culprits and better security for journalists, the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) said

title: SC directs V-C to make case of alleged sexual harassment against him part of his resume
content: The wrong which has been committed against the appellant [faculty member] may not be investigated on technical grounds, but it must not be forgotten, the Bench said

title: NIOT develops indigenous fishing boat-based real-time ocean observation system
content: NIOT has planned to conduct systematic pre- and post-monsoon surveys along five key river mouths along the Tamil Nadu coast

title: Nearly 60% of India’s outward FDI goes to ‘tax havens’, reflecting strategic potential of these countries
content: An analysis of RBI data by The Hindu shows that nearly 56% of such investments in 2024-25 were in low tax jurisdictions such as Singapore, Mauritius, UAE, the Netherlands, U.K. and Switzerland

title: Maintaining law and order is among top priorities of government, says Andhra CM
content: The police personnel should keep them updated with evolving legal aspects, says Naidu, adding that crimes done under the guise of politics will not be tolerated

title: Andhra Health Minister defends PPP model, refutes Jagan’s ‘privatisation’ claim on medical colleges
content: Satya Kumar Yadav says NDA inherited unfinished works and heavy financial burden on 17 proposed medical colleges

title: The realpolitik of a reel hero: journey of Vijay from screen to masses
content: For years, Vijay has been and remains the top-paid artiste in Kollywood and possibly among the highest-paid film stars in the country. His fans form legions ready to take up the cudgels for him, quite belligerently at that, at the mere sign of criticism — either of his movies or of the actor himself. It is this hood that he hopes will stand by him as he quits a successful career at its peak to enter politics and help him become a hero in this arena too. But what is his ideology and what are the issues that drive his party? B. Aravind Kumar analyses the political landscape, with inputs from B. Kolappan, S. Ganesan, and N. Sai Charan

title: Tiruvannamalai Corporation issues eviction notices to houses on encroached land in Arunachala Hills
content: As per a study, the Revenue Department found that there were around 3,535 illegal settlements in the hills, especially along the Girivalam path for many years.

title: Vellore police return missing phones back to its owners
content: The cybercrime team has been monitoring the missing mobile phone handsets through their IMEI number at periodical intervals.

title: Three persons killed after bus and van collide near Chengam
content: Police said the van driver Mani failed to notice a bus coming in the opposite direction on the stretch, and hit the bus, which was proceeding towards Tiruvannamalai town with around 30 commuters

title: School students visit CMC campus in Ranipet
content: Students interacted with doctors, nurses, and medical staff who patiently explained their roles and the importance of compassionate patient care.

title: HIV strains in India resist some top broadly neutralising antibodies
content: Researchers have found that Indian strains of HIV were most effectively neutralised by bNAbs targeting the virus’s V3 glycan while antibodies aimed at the V1/V2 apex of the viral spike protein were far less effective

title: Investment and digital arrest scams show an upward trend in Tamil Nadu
content: The upward trend is clear when comparing the number of investment scams reported between January and August in 2024 and 2025.

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin appeals to Centre to confer Bharat Ratna on music composer Ilaiyaraaja
content: Tamil Nadu government felicitated composer Ilaiyaraaja for serving 50 years in the film industry. The London Philharmonic Orchestra performed Ilaiyaraaja’s Valiant Symphony I and his popular numbers including Kanne Kalaimane

title: Tripura Police recover ₹7 crore in bank fraud case; cashier arrested
content: The money was drained out through cheques forging the signature of municipal corporation Commissioner D.K. Chakma from a branch of the UCO Bank

title: Muslim community in U.P. demands strict action against accused held for objectionable social media post
content: The accused allegedly posted objectionable remarks against the Quran and Prophet Muhammad on social media on September 12, prompting a large crowd to gather outside the police station and raise slogans

title: What are the enhanced powers of Foreigners Tribunals? | Explainer
content: What do the Rules of the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025 specify? How many tribunals are operational in Assam? How have their roles changed? What is the order on Sri Lankan Tamils in India?”

title: Odisha Information Commission debars RTI applicant from filing applications for a year
content: Observing that the applicant was seeking excess information, often repetitive, the Information Commissioner capped filing of number of applications at 12 in a calendar year for the applicant

title: Sébastien Lecornu | Macron’s lieutenant
content: France’s President has chosen his long-time ally to lead the government and win the support of a fractious Parliament where no party has a majority

title: Educating young voters
content: Merely having a candidate to vote for is not enough. Maturity comes from understanding democracy as a dynamic system

title: PwD representation in Central workforce stuck around 1% for over a decade: DoPT data
content: RPwD Act, 2016 hiked PwD quota to 4%, but less than 1.2% of Central government employees are disabled; DoPT data does not clarify whether all these PwD employees were hired for reserved posts only

title: Maratha community at par in education, says petitioner challenging SEBC reservation
content: A petitioner says Maratha community is “not backward” or “economically capable” during Bombay High Court hearing on SEBC Act validity

title: Tamil Nadu yet to implement expanded Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri-Jan Arogya Yojana for people aged over 70 years
content: As of now, differences of opinion between the Union government and the Tamil Nadu government with regard to the implementation have not been resolved

title: New tourism circuits being developed in Rajasthan to promote desert, tribal tourism
content: Rajasthan Deputy CM Diya Kumari said new policies were being implemented to promote concert tourism, destination weddings and meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions tourism in the State

title: Over 500 acres of land acquired for Parandur airport
content: The ₹27,400-cr. project requires 5,746 acres of land; it got in-principle nod from the Centre in April; tenders for phase I work may be floated in 2026

title: Journalist Siddique Kappan, 10 others booked after anti-UAPA protest
content: Apart from Kappan, the first information report (FIR) names Neeharika Pradaush, Pramod Puzhangara, Ambika, C.P. Rasheed, Sajid Khalid, Baburaj Bhagavathy, V.M. Faisal, Mrudhula Bhavani, Dr. Hari, and Shaneer as accused.

title: Decisions in national, public interest define our culture: U.P. CM Yogi Adityanath
content: The State Chief Minister emphasises progress and innovation in healthcare at RMLIMS foundation day ceremony

title: Special trap cages to be deployed near forests across Tamil Nadu to curb intrusion of wild boars
content: Under this approach, the captured animals will be released within 3 km of forest boundaries, keeping them close to their natural habitat while reducing crop damage in nearby farmland

title: Tamil Nadu produces the most number of engineers in the country, says Deputy CM
content: Crediting former Chief Minister Kalaignar M. Karunanidhi for the surge in engineering colleges in T.N., Udhayanidhi Stalin says engineers from the State are spread across the globe

title: Actor Vijay begins State-wide political tour with massive rally in Tiruchi
content: Accusing the BJP and DMK of ‘betraying’ and ‘tormenting’ the people, he declares that the TVK’s objective was to free Tamil Nadu of poverty, nepotism, and corruption and usher in a true and conscientious democracy

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. to present ‘Swachha Andhra Awards’
content: Modelled on Swachh Survekshan Awards, the aim is to raise the bar on maintenance of cleanliness and sanitation, says Swachha Andhra Corporation Chairman Pattabhi Ram

title: NDA’s worker conference turns into battlefield in Bihar
content: Supporters of cabinet minister Sumit Kumar Singh and former MLC Sanjay Prasad clashed with each other in the presence of Union minister Ramnath Thakur and the other senior leaders of the NDA.

title: ‘Illegal’ houses of two rape accused razed in M.P. under security
content: Bhopal Collector Kaushalendra Vikram Singh told The Hindu that the houses were built on illegally encroached government land and that the families of the two men were living there on rent.

title: AAP-BJP spar over financial aid for Punjab flood victims
content: Punjab BJP president accused the AAP government of not utilising the State Disaster Relief Fund, demanding Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to apologise to the people of Punjab

title: Push for Bharat Ratna for Kuvempu puts focus on his value system
content: The Congress government’s recent move to recommend to the Union government to confer the Bharat Ratna posthumously on Kuvempu, a towering personality of Kannada literature, puts the focus not just on his works but also his emphasis on rationality and human values

title: ‘Historic evacuation in Pak’: Punjab floods leave 2.5m displaced, 101 dead

content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. title: Best of Week 3: The SEC's top Dawg, a new ACC contender and a game-changing win for Texas A&M
content: defending defending champions Georgia drew 44-41 at the king . it was a revelation that the ACC might, too . a false start flag pushed the kick back 5 yards and Gilbert's boot never came close to the uprights .

title: After defeating Canelo, is Crawford the best fighter of his generation?
content: Terence Crawford beats canelo alvarez unanimously to become undisputed super middleweight champion . the 37-year-old enters an exclusive club as the first men's boxer in the four-belt era to earn undisputed status in three weight classes . if he decides to hang up the gloves after Saturday's performance he would retire with a 42-0 record with 31 knockouts .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 3: Notre Dame's out, A&M's in
content: Notre Dame has dropped out of the playoff conversation with an 0-2 start . it's going to last all season for the Irish, who no longer have any margin for error . this list is fluid -- and will continue to be early in the season .
